Description: Fragment of papyrus bearing four fragments of three different Coptic texts, possibly stuck together for use in bookbinding. The first text from the top has 5 lines preserved. The other two texts are harder to distinguish: one (text 3) preserves 6 lines in two different pieces, placed upside-down to and overlaying the other text, which also preserves 6 lines. The other side resembles a patchwork, with very faint traces of Coptic text on a few components. EA 75325, 75324, 75323, 75322, 75321 are mounted together.
Curator's comments: Clackson described a further fragment, now separated from this document, which was written in a similar hand to texts 2 and 3. Provenance: written by a monk of the Monastery of Apa Apollo; the acquisition details suggest a Hermopolite context (Clackson 2000). Acquired as part of 400 fragments, many of which may be interrelated. Main text published by S. Clackson, Coptic and Greek Texts, no. 65.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 139, pl.48)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86614) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86614)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
